definition: to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: So, newscaster, what's the weather like today?
sentences.chinese: 那和，新聞播音員，今天天氣怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Keep studying and you can become a newsreader.
sentences.chinese: 不斷學習，你會成爲一名新聞播音員的。
你是一位優秀的新聞播音員。

sentences.english: The weather girl batted.900 last week.
sentences.chinese: 上星期氣象報告女播音員的正確率達90%。

sentences.english: Generally, the sound of an announcer is euphonic.
sentences.chinese: 一般來說，播音員的聲音都很好聽。

sentences.english: A radio announcer for the Steelers invented the "Terrible Towel" in nineteen seventy-five.
sentences.chinese: 爲鋼人隊電臺播音員發明七五年“可怕的毛巾”。

sentences.english: Two years later he retired and became a sports announcer for the NFL.
sentences.chinese: 兩年後，他卸任，成了國家足球聯盟的播音員。

sentences.english: Avoid weekend thinking and ignore the latest dire predictions of the newscasters.
sentences.chinese: 不要理會週末的焦慮和新聞播音員最近恐慌性的言論。

sentences.english: Some foreign players and TV announcers have called for the horns to be banned.
sentences.chinese: 一些外國運動員和電視播音員呼籲的角被禁止。

sentences.english: Phoebe announces four programs a week.
sentences.chinese: 菲碧一星期擔任四個節目的播音員。

sentences.english: Do you want to be a weather reporter?
sentences.chinese: 你想成爲一名天氣預報播音員嗎？

sentences.english: "I'm the son of a newsman, I grew up around news, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 我是一名新聞播音員的兒子，我就在新聞氛圍中長大。
她是中國中央電視臺的播音員。

sentences.english: There is an ad for radio announcers in today's newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 今天的報紙上有一則招聘電臺播音員的廣告。

definition: (Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher

pinyin: Guang3 dong1 Wai4 yu3 Wai4 mao4 Da4 xue2

definition: East China University of Science and Technology
pinyin: Hua2 dong1 Li3 gong1 Da4 xue2

definition: cheerleading squad/also written 啦啦隊|啦啦队
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
secondary normal school (abbr. for 中等師範學校|中等师范学校[zhong1 deng3 shi1 fan4 xue2 xiao4])
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
